info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 2:28AM CDT until August 30 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Salt Fork Arkansas River near Alva affecting Woods and Alfalfa Counties.
Chikaskia River near Blackwell affecting Kay and Grant Counties.
Cimarron River near Dover affecting Kingfisher and Logan Counties.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Salt Fork Arkansas River near Alva.
* WHEN...From early this morning to early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Shallow flooding of lowlands to depths up to 1 foot occurs along the river in parts of northeastern Woods and northern Alfalfa counties.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 2.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The Salt Fork Arkansas River is expected to rise to a crest of 12.4 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
